meanings.definition: To establish or set in position or power
meanings.sent1: The new king was instated on the throne after the old king passed away.
meanings.sent2: The company instated a new CEO to lead the team towards success.
meanings.sent3: The cat instated itself as the ruler of the house, demanding treats and attention.
meanings.sent4: The idea of equality was instated as the guiding principle of the nation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher instated a new rule that all homework must be turned in on time.

meanings.definition: To put into effect or operation
meanings.sent1: The school instated a new dress code policy to improve discipline.
meanings.sent2: The government instated stricter regulations to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The robot instated a self-destruct sequence as a prank, causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The virus instated a lockdown on the computer system, preventing any access.
meanings.sent5: The potion instated a magical transformation, turning the frog into a prince.
